results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,m) (n>=m>=1) = maximum number of nonattacking kings on an n X m toroidal board.
comment: Independence number of the kings' graph on toroidal n X m chessboard.
For the usual non-toroidal case, the formula is ceiling(m/2)*ceiling(n/2).
reference: John J. Watkins, Across the Board: The Mathematics of Chessboard Problem, Princeton University Press, 2004, pages 194-196.
link: Dan Freeman, Chessboard Puzzles Part 4 - Other Surfaces and Variations.
mathematica: T[1, 1] = 1; T[n_, m_]:= If[m==1, Floor[n/2], Floor[Min[m Floor[n/2], n Floor[m/2]]/2]]; Flatten[Table[T[n,m], {n, 1, 12},{m, 1,n}]] (* _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 09 2017 *)
program: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {for(n=1, 12, for(m=1, n, print1(if(m==1,if(n==1, 1, floor(n/2)), floor(min(m*floor(n/2), n*floor(m/2))/2)),", ");); print();); };
